entry.title: Gr√∂nlandspaddlar, Norsaq och Harpuner
entry.summary: Gr√∂nlandspaddlar Mina Paddlar √§r l√§tta, eleganta och med skuldror som standard. P√• samma s√§tt som Qajaqer kan jag skr√§ddarsy din paddel! Normalt g√∂r jag hela paddlar men om n√•gon vill s√• kan jag s√§tta in en delning av kolfiber (Gearlabs Ferrule). Jag tillverkar paddlar av…
entry.content:
Gr√∂nlandspaddlar

Mina Paddlar √§r l√§tta, eleganta och med skuldror som standard. P√• samma s√§tt som Qajaqer kan jag skr√§ddarsy din paddel! Normalt g√∂r jag hela paddlar men om n√•gon vill s√• kan jag s√§tta in en delning av kolfiber (Gearlabs Ferrule).¬†¬†

Jag tillverkar paddlar av svensk gran, jag k√∂per st√∂rre bitar material och s√•gar ut det som √§r kvistfritt i m√∂jligaste m√•n. En standardpaddel √§r gjord i sex delar som jag limmar ihop. Detta g√∂r att eventuella svagheter i en bit kompenseras av de andra runt omkring samt att den inte sl√•r sig, vrider sig. Normall√§ngd √§r mellan 210-220 cm och avst√•nget mellan skuldrorna 42 cm. √Ñr inte det lite smalt mellan h√§nderna tycker n√•gon? Kanske, det har passat mina kompisar i flera √•r efter de f√•tt paddla med dem men vill du ha n√•got annat m√•tt s√• h√∂r av dig, ingen extra kostnad. Bredden √§r 70-80 mm vilket passar i de flesta milj√∂er. Samma h√§r, vill du ha en smalare eller bredare s√• ordnar jag det. Vikten beror fr√§mst p√• kvalit√©n p√• virket men brukar hamna p√• mellan 650 - 850 gram.

Du kan ocks√• best√§lla en paddel med extra finesser som f√∂rst√§rkta spetsar, annan f√§rg eller vad du vill. Jag kanske inte kan g√∂ra allt men h√∂r av dig s√• pratar vi om det. üòäDavid.o.tang@gmail.com

Norsaq och harpuner

En norsaq beh√∂ver alla som har lite ambitioner kring sin rollning. I grund och botten √§r det en bit tr√§ som du kan rolla med och kasta en harpun med. Ska du bara rolla s√• √§r det b√§ttre om den inte √§r anpassad till en harpun.¬†

Vill du kasta harpun s√• g√∂r jag harpun och norsaq som passar. Du f√•r en harpun med ett s√• kallat f√∂rskaft som √§r fastbundet med l√§derremmar. Dock ing√•r inte spets, lina, eller avataq.¬†
Det √§r riktigt kul att l√§gga ut ett m√•l i vattnet och f√∂rs√∂ka tr√§ffa. Kanske en grej till klubben och en liten t√§vling? D√• blir jag lycklig i och med att ni bidrar till att f√∂ra traditionerna vidare.¬†

entry.title: Reverse Sweep Elbow Roll
entry.summary: Yes! The holy grail of Rolls... This roll is introduced in the Swedish Greenland Rolling Competition in 2025. Why? Isn't it impossible? Well, I may never be able to carry this one out but for all the great rollers out there this may be the…
entry.content:
Yes! The holy grail of Rolls...¬†

This roll is introduced in the Swedish Greenland Rolling Competition in 2025.¬†

Why? Isn't it impossible?¬†

Well, I may never be able to carry this one out but for all the great rollers out there this may be the utimate challange. I hope that someone in the next few years will carry this roll out, perhaps sooner... I really hope that it will be someone young! Come and beat us oldies!¬†

I have tried the Reverse Sweep Elbow roll a couple of sessions and I'm not even close. This is a tough one but as I said - a challange. I really enjoy having a new goal, a new quest!¬†

To be continued...

entry.title: Handcuff Roll
entry.summary: What!? A new roll... on the competition list? Yes, this is a spoiler... well not for long. The Handcuff roll together with the Reverse Sweep Elbow roll is introduced to the Swedish Greenland Rolling competition in 2025. A rope loop is now part of your…
entry.content:
What!? A new roll... on the competition list?

Yes, this is a spoiler... well not for long. The Handcuff roll together with the Reverse Sweep Elbow roll is introduced to the Swedish Greenland Rolling competition in 2025.¬†

A rope loop is now part of your personal equipment (TBC, To be confirmed) and the diameter should be around 20cm (TBC). The roll is like a version of the Straight Jacket roll so basically everything from that post applies.
The new difficulty is that as I now have my hands behind my back, basically knuckle to knuckle, it is harder to "slide" up on the back deck than in the Straight Jacket. I have my arms in a better position so I can get "wide on the water" or at least wider... I need to arch my back a lot more than in the SJ so the "Camel" and "Cobra" pose will be used a lot during yoga practice. I started out holding my hands at my side, knuckles in. Then I moved the hands closer together behind my back until my fingertips touched. After that I thought I was home free - not so! It is harder than I thought to form fists or at least hold the rope loop as the final step. Now I haven't practiced more than one session but I would hold this roll almost, or as hard as the Straight Jacket roll. That may be revised but now I really feel my years and stiffness.¬†

Update! Now I've had another session and found some tricks that work for me. The capsize can be slow if I do a "faceplant" with shoulders flat on the water. I find it hard to crunch with my hands on my back so I knife my shoulders until I reach the surface. I discovered that since my cockpit coaming is very far back my hands catch on it. In my qajaq I need to raise my hands rather high on my back to avoid getting stuck. When I got this worked out the Handcuff roll isn't that mysterious any more. Still not an easy one!

¬†

entry.title: Vad h√§nder n√§r jag best√§ller en kajak?
entry.summary: Lite mystiskt √§r det... hur kan Kajakskr√§ddaren veta hur jag vill ha min kajak? L√•t mig ber√§tta vad som h√§nder: 1. Vi pratas vid, telefon, chatt, Teams eller liknande, helst tr√§ffas vi. Jag vill veta vem du √§r, hur brukar du paddla/rolla, vad anv√§nder du…
entry.content:
Lite mystiskt √§r det... hur kan Kajakskr√§ddaren veta hur jag vill ha min kajak?

L√•t mig ber√§tta vad som h√§nder:¬†

1. Vi pratas vid, telefon, chatt, Teams eller liknande, helst tr√§ffas vi. Jag vill veta vem du √§r, hur brukar du paddla/rolla, vad anv√§nder du idag (om n√•got), vad vill du g√∂ra/utveckla i din nya kajak? Din kunskapsniv√• avg√∂r en del av designen.¬†

2. Du f√•r ange dina kroppsm√•tt, som vikt, l√§ngd, avst√•nd mellan sittben och h√§lar etc. Du f√•r en lista och lite bilder p√• hur du ska m√§ta. Eventuellt l√§gger jag upp den nedan. H√§r kommer en ny aspekt in, hur flexibel √§r du i kroppen? Vi kan ta den diskussionen privat men det ger vissa friheter om du √§r flexibel men det viktiga √§r att din kajak kommer att passa inte bara dina yttre kroppsm√•tt utan hur du kan anv√§nda din kropp och kajak. Allt f√∂r att det ska bli DIN kajak. Naturligtvis kommer andra att kunna paddla den men det √§r DIG den √§r perfekt till.¬†

3. Jag b√∂rjar bygga, vill du s√• f√•r du rapport fr√•n mig efter varje byggdag s√• du ser vad som h√§nder och f√•r se hur din kajak tar form. MEN, jag kan bara g√∂ra s√• mycket utan dig.¬†

4. Provning! Jo, det √§r som hos skr√§ddaren, du f√•r komma och prova innan allt √§r klart. Om du vill virar vi in din kajak i plast s√• du kan prova den i vattnet ocks√•, d√• ser vi exakt hur m√•nga milimeter fribord du har och hur din kajak ligger i vattnet.¬†
Vi ser till att fotst√∂d hamnar exakt, att l√•rst√∂det hamnar p√• r√§tt st√§lle √∂ver l√•ren, att masik blir lagom h√∂g s√• att den inte hindrar om du b√∂jer dig fram, med mera. "Allt" g√•r att √§ndra till dina √∂nskem√•l i detta skede. Vill du s√• hj√§lper jag till med vad jag anser vara r√§tt f√∂r dig men det √§r du som best√§mmer.¬†
Rollare brukar avsluta provsittningen i poolen med en f√∂rsta roll. Det blir bara en eller ett par rollar d√• vi s√§llan har tuiliq p√• vid provsittning.¬†

5. Jag bygger f√§rdigt din kajak enligt det vi kommit √∂verens om. F√∂rst skelettet och sedan kl√§r jag den med ett nylontyg. Jag f√∂redrar 240g per kvadratmeter i tygtjocklek men du kan f√• ett tjockare tyg p√• 460g per kvadratmeter. Skillnaden √§r mest k√§nsla och kanske ett par hekto i vikt, det tjockare tyget absorberar mer lack ocks√•. N√§st sista steg √§r lackning, h√§r kan du f√• v√§lja din egen f√§rg! Jag anv√§nder pigment fr√•n Claessons Tr√§tj√§ra s√• allt de har kan du v√§lja mellan. Detta √§r faktiskt ett av de tuffaste valen f√∂r de kunder jag haft... Jag v√§ljer alltid en ljust brun till mig sj√§lv... fast jag kan kanske t√§nka om.

6. Kajaken √§r din! Vi √§r troligtvis goda v√§nner du och jag vid det h√§r laget. Som du m√§rker vill jag verkligen att det ska bli riktigt bra. Jag √∂nskar att du ska f√• uppleva den gl√§djen och k√§nslan som en Skr√§ddarsydd kajak kan ge. Den blir verkligen personlig. Dessutom blir jag lycklig var g√•ng jag lyfter upp min p√• biltaket! Cirka 11-12 kg brukar vikten sluta p√•. Sm√• kajaker kan hamna lite l√§gre men det beror p√• det tr√§ jag f√•r tag p√• ocks√•. En turkajak kan bli 1-2 kg tyngre men 14 kg kajak √§r fortfarande en fr√∂jd att lyfta upp p√• bilen.¬†

Nedan √§r en Turkajak, inspirerad av Anas Acuta. Byggd till min fru...

entry.title: Kajakskr√§ddaren
entry.summary: Vad √§r nu detta, Svenska!? Jo, jag bygger nu Skin on Frame kajaker till andra √§n mig sj√§lv! üòØ I och med att DU som kan t√§nkas vara intresserad troligen bor n√§ra mig (Norden), s√• k√§nner jag att det √§r mer personligt att skriva p√•…
entry.content:
Vad √§r nu detta, Svenska!?

Jo, jag bygger nu Skin on Frame kajaker till andra √§n mig sj√§lv! üòØ
I och med att DU som kan t√§nkas vara intresserad troligen bor n√§ra mig (Norden), s√• k√§nner jag att det √§r mer personligt att skriva p√• svenska. Hur g√•r det till att best√§lla en kajak fr√•n mig? Kolla h√§r!

Vill ni ha en tuiliq som passar till er qajaq s√• s√§ljer jag RUGD tuiliqs! Riktigt bra kvalite, 3 mm neoprene, sn√∂rning runt ansiktet, elastiskt kardborreband kring handlederna. Endast svarta f√∂r tillf√§llet.¬†

En Skin on Frame kajak √§r en traditionellt byggd kajak som de tillverkats under 100-tals kanske 1000-tals √•r p√• Gr√∂nland och i Arktis. Den best√•r av ett skelett i tr√§ som sedan kl√§s med duk, traditionellt s√§lskinn, som sedan g√∂rs vattent√§tt med lack, traditionellt anv√§ndes fett och sp√§ck. En kajak som √§r byggd p√• detta s√§tt kan √§ven betecknas Qajaq som √§r den Gr√∂nl√§ndska stavningen.¬†

Helst bygger jag dedikerade rollkajaker, det √§r jag b√§st p√•, men om du vill ha en dagsturs- eller tur-kajak s√• g√•r det ocks√•. Kajaken byggt till DIG, enligt dina kroppsm√•tt och till dina √∂nskem√•l.

Rollkajak: P√• SM i G√∂teborg -24 var faktiskt ganska m√•nga av mina kajaker med √§ven om de absolut flesta faktiskt var byggda f√∂r min kropp. Plats nummer 1, 2, 3 och 5 har kajaker som jag byggt. Det s√§ger lite om hur bra det blir med en dedikerad rollkajak. Denna kajak √§r extremt liten volym i, vi str√§var efter 15 mm fribord som √§r gr√§nsen f√∂r t√§vling. Den √§r rak i k√∂llinjen, platt i botten akter√∂ver och lite mer V form f√∂r√∂ver. Ett runt f√∂rd√§ck ger en snabb och l√§tt roll, ett platt och l√•gt och platt akterd√§ck utan ett irriterade ryggst√∂d som biter sig in i korsryggen ger dig en m√∂jlighet att lyckas med till och med en Straight Jacket roll. Med bredd och h√∂jd f√∂r l√•rst√∂den som anpassas p√• millimetern till din kropp och stil f√•r du en kajak som inte kommer att s√§tta n√•gra begr√§nsningar.¬†

Dagstur:¬†Liknar rollkajaken till stora delar med nu √∂kar vi p√• volymen lite s√• vi inte f√•r in vatten i v√•gorna. Nu f√•r du √§ven m√∂jlighet att ta med dig lite mats√§ck och annan packning. En lite bekv√§mare kajak men du v√§ljer om du vill l√•ta den g√• √•t roll- eller tur- h√•llet.

Turkajak: ¬†Vill du ha en kajak som √§r mer √•t det "vanliga" h√•llet som √§r en Skin on Frame variant av till exempel en Anas Acuta (Valley) eller liknande s√• bygger jag g√§rna en s√•dan. Turkajaker utrustas g√§rna med vattent√§ta p√•sar (stora avl√•nga) som fyller upp utrymmet framf√∂r fotst√∂den och akter om ryggen f√∂r s√§kerhet och packm√∂jligheter. Man kan ocks√• anv√§nda en s√• kallad "SeaSock" som √§r som en mjuk sittbrunn.
Ska du p√• veckol√•ng tur? Kontakta Kajakkspesialistens Anders Thygessen och be honom bygga en Baidarka.

Jag g√∂r √§ven gr√∂nlandspaddlar - hela eller delbara, norsaq och harpuner (med norsaq).¬†

√Ñr du intresserad s√• kontakta mig p√•:¬†

david.o.tang@gmail.com¬†

s√• kan vi prata vidare.

Fj√§rde leveransen fr√•n Kajakskr√§ddaren!¬†

√Ñven denna Qajaq kommer att f√• bo i Danmark, har den starka Danska kronan med saken att g√∂ra??? En utpr√§glad rollqajaq som Frank ska ha f√∂r att utmana Jakob (D13) i de Danska M√§sterskapen i Gr√∂nlandsroll. Jag blev lite √∂verraskad n√§r f√§rgen best√§mdes snabbt och best√§mt till orange! Det blev ju s√• snyggt! Mycket positiv till denna nyansen! Linjerna blev ocks√• som jag hade visualiserat s√• jag hoppas att den rollar som Frank vill att den ska rolla.¬†

Tredje leveransen fr√•n Kajakskr√§ddaren!¬†

D-15 numera d√∂pt till M√•sart (eller Mozart) blev en utmaning. En dedikerad rollkajak till en l√§tt person!!! Den √§r den l√§gsta, minst fr√•n k√∂l till relingen, som jag n√•gonsin byggt. 11 cm i totaldjup om jag minns r√§tt! M√§t upp 11 cm och se efter, det √§r v√§ldigt lite volym. M√∂nster och f√§rgvalet - oj! En hel del prat och diskussioner, sedan fick jag best√§mma sj√§lv. Jag gjorde mitt b√§sta, kanske skulle jag l√•tit kunden komma och lacka den sj√§lv...

Den √§r mycket omtyckt vad jag har f√∂rst√•tt och jag har f√•tt en ny v√§n!¬†

Andra leveransen fr√•n Kajakskr√§ddaren!

D-14 (Dagstur - Roll) togs emot den 29 december 2024. Som jag uppfattade det var kajaken mycket efterl√§ngtad och √§lskad redan vid leverans. üòç Detta var ett special uppl√§gg d√§r det ingick extra allt! Pulley system f√∂r att f√• in packning eller flytkroppar i f√∂ren och aktern, skedda som √§r avtagbar, en paddel nummer 45 samt instruktion f√∂r att g√∂ra en handroll. Handrollen satt 3-4 g√•nger p√• var sida under lektionen, f√•r se om den sitter... Det var ett k√§nslofyllt m√∂te och avsked, D-14 √§r vacker och inte bara en rollkajak. D-14 har en design f√∂r att b√•de rolla utm√§rkt samt vara bekv√§m p√• dagsturer. Jag hoppas att ni kommer finna mycket gl√§dje tillsammans. F√§rgen √§r en utblandad Milori-bl√•.

F√∂rsta leveransen fr√•n Kajakskr√§ddaren!

D-13 (Rollkajak) togs emot av sin best√§llare fredagen den 13 December 2024. Jag √§r s√§ker p√• att kajaken kommer att f√• ett bra hem hos den tv√•faldige Danske M√§staren! Den provrollades p√• Kungsbackafjorden under dagen och de b√•da verkar komma mycket bra √∂verens. Ryktet s√§ger att Straight Jacket rollen √§r n√§ra nu...

entry.title: Skin on Frame Material
entry.summary: I've been asked several times where to get material for a Skin on Frame SoF build in Sweden or northen Europe. Here is a list of my suppliers which I hope will be useful for You as well. Lumber: I go to my local lumberstore…
entry.content:
I've been asked several times where to get material for a Skin on Frame SoF build in Sweden or northen Europe. Here is a list of my suppliers which I hope will be useful for You as well.¬†

Lumber: I go to my local lumberstore for all straight lumber. I spend time to select the best Spruce lumber I can find. My suggestion is to buy a bit larger dimensions than you need and cut around the worst knots, also to laminate the gunwales to avoid weak areas. Byggmax is my store in Kungsbacka.¬†

Bending stock: I haven't found "green" or freshly cut bending stock yet but I keep looking. In the meantime I buy Ash planks from Abi Tr√§ in Fr√∂lunda (Gothenburg). Same procedure here to find straight grain planks and so far the material I've got is very good. Last build (number 10) I didn't break any ribs but usually up to a third of the ribs break.¬†

Cloth: The best cloth I've found is excellent! Provided by Marcin Bober in Poland. Marcin hasn't set up a website yet but is very professional in everything he delivers. His english is understandable albeit not perfect but don't let that discourage you. Also don't be alarmed as you may be asked to use his wifes PayPal account, Mimi's Soapery. Among other things Marcin provides Nylon cloth of two thicknesses, 260 grams per square meter and 430 grams per square meter. I've used both and I'm very happy with it. To get in contact with Marcin check Facebook or write me and I'll set you up.¬†¬†

Thread/Artificial Sinew: Same supplier as above Marcin Bober! Ask for your specific colour, you may be in luck.¬†

PU varnish: Same supplier as above for 2-part PU, Marcin Bober! Works great! I sometimes use Coelan 1-part PU which I like even better as I don't have to mix it and it handles great. It cost about 3-4 times as much as Marcin's PU so it is very doubtful if it is worth it. I get Coelan from Toplicht in Hamburg. Three cans of 750 ml is sufficient.¬†

Leather cord: I love to use the traditional deck riggings using leather cords and sliders. I buy round english leather cord from Tj√§derl√§der. 5 mm for the rigging front and aft of the cockpit and 7 mm for loops front and aft to stick your paddle into. 5 m of 5 mm and 0,5-1 m of 7mm cord. They may not be the cheapest but the best I've found. Sorry to say but I don't think they have a webpage in english, send me a mail if you need help.

Pigments: I use pigment in the second layer of varnish to "dye" my qajaqs. As the pigment is basically crushed stone it doesn't fade and is in itself an UV protection. My local supplier is Claessons Tr√§tj√§ra at Ring√∂n, Gothenburg. They also have the best linseed oil! The colours are of course limited but you can always mix them. In stock they have multiple variations of: White, Red, Yellow, Terra (brown), Umbra (brown), Green, Blue, and Black.¬†

If I can do anything to help or assist you in your build, don't hesitate to contact me at david.o.tang@gmail.com or via Facebook, Messenger, Instagram etc.¬†

Note: I don't get any benefits from the companies mentioned above. I have been searching for suppliers in my region of the world for 5-6 years and this is the current list.¬†

entry.title: Useful links
entry.summary: As always, a lot of people have done a lot of work a lot better than I could ever do. To start with; how do you get your first roll. I don't intend to teach the first roll as others can do that better. Perhaps…
entry.content:
As always, a lot of people have done a lot of work a lot better than I could ever do.¬†

To start with; how do you get your first roll. I don't intend to teach the first roll as others can do that better. Perhaps I can help in person, but that's off the scope for the webpage. My recommendation is to find professional rolling teachers locally. If they are hard to find then get the DVD:

"This is the Roll" by Cheri Perry and Turner Wilson of Kayakways.

You can find it as a Disc as well on their site: www.kayakways.net

Excellent instructions and animations on Eiichi Eto's page Storm On

Paddlegear at Reed Chillcheater

Greenland paddles at Gram Kayak

Skin on Frame, Norwegian Wood paddles and more with Anders Thygesen at Kajakkspesialisten
Note that Anders sells Brooks Tuiliqs!¬†

My club "The Rolling Lunatics" or "Rolltokarna"

¬†

entry.title: 34 Paddling Upside Down
entry.summary: This manoeuvre is pretty straight forward. I put my paddle under the qajaq, capsize and go. Now there are a few hint to be able to go far... First of all - go straight! The points awarded are calculated from the straight line and I…
entry.content:
This manoeuvre is pretty straight forward. I put my paddle under the qajaq, capsize and go. Now there are a few hint to be able to go far...

First of all - go straight! The points awarded are calculated from the straight line and I normally have to paddle next to a line in the water with distance markings. If the water is clear it can be possible to see the line and adjust my path to it. I get 1 point for the first 3 meters and 1 additional point for every two meters after that. 5 meters is 2 points, so is 6 meters.¬†

I have seen paddlers rocking the qajaq to get the paddle deeper in the water as in a sprint stroke. That is a good idea both for power and for going straight.

To get a low profile under water is beneficial, lower drag, longer distance. I try to have my nose on the deck but it's hard. Hard to see where I'm going and hard because I compress my lungs.¬†

The most important aspect of this manoeuvre is to hold my breath for a looooong time. I have got some help from free divers. When I practice I rarely measure my distance, more counting the seconds or strokes I make. Counting strokes are easier, seconds have a tendency for me to speed up as I get a bit stressed under water.¬†

Practice paddling upside down! There are a lot of points go gain and it's not very difficult. It can be worth as much as a Straight Jacket Roll... (23 meters = 11 points)

Judges note: The distance is measured along the straight marked line.¬†

entry.title: 33 Straight Jacket Roll
entry.summary: I have finally made it. With the excellent help and instructions of Anne-Sofie Furuhaug and J√∂rgen Fagereng Wessel! Thank you! This is an excellent example of how hands on instruction is invaluable to written instructions. I posted the instructions I got from Anne-Sofie and J√∂rgen…
entry.content:
I have finally made it. With the excellent help and instructions of Anne-Sofie Furuhaug and J√∂rgen Fagereng Wessel! Thank you! This is an excellent example of how hands on instruction is invaluable to written instructions. I posted the instructions I got from Anne-Sofie and J√∂rgen earlier this spring but couldn't make out what I really needed to do. I invited them to come from Norway, they did and they taught me.¬†

This is what I can tell you about my journey so far.

Prerequisites:¬†
- A strong will to succeed, the process can be a bit painful at times.¬†
- A qajaq that fits you, low back deck, full contact with your thighs.¬†
- Good twist in your torso.
- An understanding of what supports you; water, shoulders, secondary stability, weight distribution inside and out.¬†
- You should be able to do an Elbow roll with some ease, double elbow as well. If not start there.¬†

Yoga and stretching. YES! For me this is somewhat painful but makes all the difference. And it takes time so don't set a timetable, do what you can and things will come to you.¬†

Qajaq: This is one of the reasons I got into SOF qajaq building, so I can build myself a qajaq which allows me to do a SJ roll. Not that the qajaq does anything for you but some attributes need to be fulfilled. My current one (T2D5 - Tv√•ngsTr√∂ja David #5 or Strait Jacket David #5) is great, built for this purpose alone. There are two issues with it, the masik is a tad too high and it's black, l loved my brown ones. The R2D4 (Rockhopping and Roll David#4) had a masik slightly lower and I had to push my knees under it, so I raised it 1 cm for T2D5 and now I regret it a bit. When I lean forward my arms touch the masik stopping me from getting low on the foredeck. This isn't a problem in forward finishing rolls since my arms are not in the way but....¬†
Padding and a snug fit is vital for this roll. Both at the masik and at the hips. If your hips slide down in the qajaq to the water gunwale it's very hard to get past the secondary stability and on to the back deck. I have now padded my hips as much as I can without restricting butt/hip movement.¬†

The main things I work on at the moment are:
Getting my shoulders flat and parallel to the surface as I reach up towards the sky before I start the backward sweep.

As I get to the static brace position I push my head back and try to keep my shoulders flat. I can now stay in the static brace - straight jacket style - if my timing is a bit off and I can't recover in one motion. It's clear to me now that timing is important but not crucial.

To recover to the back deck I need to ease up with my lower back first, then chest and head out of the water last. This is what Anne-Sofie and J√∂rgen wrote to me and later showed in detail.¬†

Additional sources:¬†

I also got this answer from Anne-Sofie Furuhaug and J√∂rgen Fagereng Wessel on Facebook:

Straitjacket roll learning process:
I assume you already know the hand and elbow rolls.
I split most back ending rolls in two parts:
1) the capsized to balance brace and
2) balance brace to back deck.
For the straitjacket roll getting the first part is a matter of timing, strong hip/knee drive and sufficient twisting of upper body. The second part is what most people seem to struggle with. If you manage to use the momentum from the first part that is great, but I found that it was easier to simply learn it from balance brace.
Again, good twist of upper body is important, so is backward flexibility (practice the cobra stance in yoga).
I practiced a lot of balance bracing! Then it was beginning to go from balance brace to back deck with hands folded, and repeating while gradually moving the hands closer to the correct straitjacket position. In the beginning I found it helps moving my sea leg over to the other side in the kayak (every bit helps).
The kayak matters a lot, so does padding and fitting. I can not do the straitjacket roll in many kayaks, and I have some padding under front of the kayak (like a padded masik) and some at the hips to keep me from slipping too far to one side of the kayak. If it is too tight it limits my movement and twisting.
It is important to try to use the lower back muscles to try to get the lower back up on the back deck, not just the upper torso and head.

I found this on Helen Wilsons site www.greenlandorbust.org

Often when first attempting the Straitjacket Roll, the paddler tries to ‚Äúsweep‚Äù onto the back deck, and essentially bumps into it. They can hang out there all day (breathing), but not actually get onto the deck. Does this sound familiar? In this description, the ‚Äúsweep‚Äù is the problem. This ‚Äúsweep‚Äù usually works with a hand roll, fist roll, brick roll and sometimes even the Elbow Roll, but it will not work with the Straightjacket Roll. For the Straightjacket Roll, you need to think of your upper body as a lever, and instead of trying to ‚Äúsweep‚Äù onto the back deck, push your upper body toward the ground, which will give you the leverage to fully recover. Following are the steps to a successful Straightjacket Roll (described with a right-side recovery):

‚Äì Place your arms against your chest with your fingers and thumbs under your armpits.

‚Äì Capsize to the left with your shoulders parallel to the side of the kayak and your forehead down (this will give you a rounded spine).

‚Äì RELAX until your body gets to the highest position possible on the right side of the kayak (your shoulders should be parallel to the surface).

‚Äì Throw your upper body toward the ground, using your back as a lever and keeping your shoulders parallel to the surface. Simultaneously, drive hard with the right knee.

‚Äì Slide up onto the back deck (your head may hit the side of the kayak during the recovery).

‚Äì Helen

¬†
¬†
Two pros giving their thoughts. I sincerely thank you both.¬†
¬†
Judges note
Your forearms shall be pressed against your body throughout the roll and your fingers shall remain in your armpits.¬†
¬†
Earlier attempts for reference:

¬†

entry.title: 32 Elbow Roll
entry.summary: The elbow roll is quite a bit more difficult than the previous lay back rolls. Not as hard as the forward finishing clenched fist and brick rolls but still. Have a look at the preparations working up to the Brick roll Layback - they are…
entry.content:
The elbow roll is quite a bit more difficult than the previous lay back rolls. Not as hard as the forward finishing clenched fist and brick rolls but still.¬†

Have a look at the preparations working up to the Brick roll Layback - they are the same as to the elbow roll and then some.¬†

When I started trying the elbow roll I was amazed at how much lift I do get using my hand or fist. Not only is that lift gone in the elbow roll but there is a another more subtle difficulty. As I put my hand on the back of my head it is much harder for me to arch back. This is mostly a mental thing but also a bit of flexibility of the shoulder. When I try arching my head back in this position my elbow like to come forward. This means that I need to actively push my elbow out and down during the little sweep I get. Don't get me wrong, I don't mean to push the elbow down for support like I can get from a paddle, just push it out so it lays parallel to the surface and don't point to the sky. If you push it down for support it will sink and our shoulders will knife.¬†

My arching is more pronounced and I use both my legs to turn the qajaq. I've mentioned it several times before and I have a different feeling when using both legs in lay back versus forward finishing rolls. In lay back rolls I try to push my non-water leg out, like out to the gunwhale, in forward finishing rolls I push it down, like to the bottom of the qajaq. I've found it easier to push the non-water leg out in lay back rolls as I can arch my back more, or at least it feels easier. In forward finishing i crunch my abs in this position and pushing the non-water leg down is ok. I find more momentum with my legs pushing down if the timing is right.¬†

As in all rolls, don't raise your head out of the water until last. I have good momentum in the roll in the video so I get away with it.¬†

Strangely enough I set up very differently in the elbow roll than in all the other lay back rolls. I twist my torso so I face sideways, point the elbow forward and capsize. It feels like doing a face-plant into the water. Most people try to lean forward close to the fore deck and I guess that's fine but it doesn't work for me.¬†

Lastly, hold your position - facing sideways or forward until your nose get very close to the surface before you un-tuck and sweep your torso.¬†

Judges note: The hand shall stay on the back of your head throughout the whole roll. It is ok to use the other arm as counterweight.¬†
